intro: Anogra latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf anogra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
